alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 6:36PM MST until May 20 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Part of Yavapai County, including Cottonwood and Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM MST, trained spotter reported ongoing water standing in their backyard in Cottonwood. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coyote Spring, Cienega Creek, Sycamore Creek, Oak Wash, West Clear Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Verde River, Gaddis Wash, Beaver Creek, Munds Draw, Ash Creek, Bitter Creek, Oak Creek and Railroad Draw. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Clarkdale, Verde Village, Cottonwood, Bridgeport, Cherry, Middle Verde, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Lake Montezuma, Jerome, Dead Horse Ranch State Park, Tuzigoot National Monument, Mingus Mountain Campground, Playground Group Campground and Potato Patch Campground. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
